thread.title: Two arrested in connection to Moka Cafe murders
thread.title_full: Two arrested in connection to Moka Cafe murders | Toronto Star

author: Stephanie Werner
title: Two arrested in connection to Moka Cafe murders
text:
Arrests have been made by York Regional Police in connection to the deadly Moke Café shooting .
Jason Hay, 27, of Mississauga was apprehended travelling north on Hwy 400. The vehicle was stopped on Friday between Mapleview Dr. and Essa Rd. Hay has been wanted by police in connection to the murders since the beginning of August.
A female in the vehicle was also taken into custody.
The shooting took place the morning of June 24, just south of Highway 7 and Islington Ave. Police have called the incident a “targeted” attack. Two people died at the scene: Maria Voci, a 47-year-old mother of three and employee at the café, and Christopher De Simone, a 24-year-old Vaughan native.
Two other men were seriously injured, one critically. The two surviving victims have since been released from hospital. Among the two other victims was Rocco Di Paola, a candidate in last fall’s mayoral election in Toronto.
Hay is facing two counts of first degree murder and two counts of attempted murder.
Tashari Bennett, 25, of Mississauga has been charged with accessory after the fact and breach of recognizance.
The investigation is ongoing and additional charges are possible, said police.

The man Jason Hay, 27
